intro: Pleroma kunthianum, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers and climbing habit. The plant produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh desert environment. Pleroma kunthianum is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a resilient species in arid ecosystems.
